intro: Guatteria anthracina, commonly known as the red-flowered guatteria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Lauraceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly found in humid lowland forests. The plant is characterized by its large, glossy, ovate leaves and striking red flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows as an evergreen shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. The fruit is a small, fleshy berry that ripens to a yellow or orange color, attracting various wildlife species.
